30688628.review:
[h1]Pros:[/h1]
+ Well-designed environments (nothing to say, everything fits really well especially with the music)
+ Music (Alexander Brandon and Michael Van Den Bos did a great job for Epic games as usual, I'd recommend to listen to the stuff that they've created for another games too like (Jazz Jackrabbit, Deus Ex and etc.) or even check out the games themselves because they're pretty awesome too.
+ Story and the lore overall
+ Comfy UE1 rendering (even better with the dx12 overhaul)
+ Editor is a masterpiece (You build the map with special "brushes", which are basically 3D primitives which means that you don't actually have to know anything about 3D modelling in order to build your own map, the engine supports special archives where you can store your custom textures and use them for your own maps, however if you in example were to change some built-in 3D models, scripts, sounds (?), you would probably need to recompile a half of the game. As I understood, modding UE1 games is a great challenge because you need the exact version of the engine the game was compiled on + some of the developers were modifying the engine to have some extra features they wanted to see in their games, which means, I guess, that without any kind of reverse-engenering skills modifying the game is from hard to impossible, also the engine is proprietary.
[h1]Cons:[/h1]
- Shooting mechanics (it's kind of clunky, great variety of weapons, however after beating the game I didn't manage to figure out the purpose of each weapon (if they even have any or just designed for the player to have a wide choice)
- Enemy design (the whole pool of the enemies didn't bring anything new to the genre, there are a lot of the enemies with the basic patterns just for the diversity, even from the point of 1997 there was nothing really new to it).
- Rare change of the pace (for me means that the game is a little bit monotonous, however that happens sometimes (Serpent Canyon and etc))
- Boss fights (Just shoot it till it dies, pure boredom)
- Some levels (near the end of the game) took me a lot of time because of running in circles, trying to understand where to go.

To sum up, this is a great demo for Unreal engine, especially for its time, also the game without any kind of huge letdowns. For the best experience I would recommend to play on easy or something like that, because I don't really feel like this can be a really interesting and challenging experience from the point of the actual game mechanics today. Was kind of a chore to finish the game, though the first part felt great for some reason, maybe it gets repetetive really quick. 7.5

29757465.review:
The game that made Epic epic. This review is based heavily on the CD ROM and GOG.com (DRM-free) releases of Unreal Gold. So my Steam time with Unreal doesn't even come close to my experience with this time-tested classic.

While Unreal Tournament gets damn near all the spot light for Epic, and understandably so, it really started as an add-on for Unreal. Unreal Tournament was originally an expansion for the, admittedly weak, multiplayer component of Unreal. However, Unreal's single player core game is phenominal. In fact, the core mechanics, graphics engine, and weapon functions that made Unreal Tournament a masterpiece were first introduced in Unreal.

Unreal's single player experience has aged like the finest of wines. The minimalist story practically tells itself via the environment. The atmosphere draws the player into a fully realized world. The music sets the mood for much of what's going on, and even drops out altogether at some points allowing a vaccuum to add tension or calm. While the graphics definitely show their age, they get the job done and almost lend a "vintage" feel to a game from a ground breaking era. In single player, Unreal is neck-and-neck with Quake.

In this era of dumbed down, "hyper realistic" military themed FPSes with tacked on single player campaigns, I've grown to appreciate Unreal Gold more than ever.

29502971.review:
The original Unreal joins the ranks of Doom, Quake, and Duke Nukem 3D as one of the best "classic FPS games" from the 1990s. It truly was groundbreaking at its release back in 1998 and it really set the foundations for games for the next millenium. Except for mouse acceleration (which I believe can be fixed by a mod? I don't know), the gameplay still holds up compared to modern games. Most enemies are able to dodge projectiles quite well and never stand still. Some of them even use a variety of weapons too. Every single weapon and item you pick up is still useable up to the very end of the game, and the game doesn't hold your hand and take you to your destination; you have to figure out where to go and what to do all by yourself.

All of the levels look incredible - to vast caverns and plains, dangerous cliffs and ancient alien temples with familiar yet weird and fantastic architecture filled with intricate hallways, and futuristic spaceships, with a unique soundtrack to go with it. However if you're looking for more of a "cinematic" experience, this game doesn't have it. Story is mostly told through your personal experience and observations from simply playing the game and through journals that you pick up. Proper characters and dialogue are not present at all.

I want everyone to experience this game because It truly is a great game that every FPS fan deserves to play. It was one giant step forward for the video game industry back in the day and although people probably won't appreciate it like I did back when I first played it at 10 years old, it's still a great "retro" experience if anything.

29192379.review: Todos los años cuando empiezan me propongo pasarme o darle una oportunidad a una saga. El año pasado fue Dead Space y Stalker, y este año le tocó a Unreal. Unreal fue una saga muy conocida por los Unreal Tournament en la época de los cyber. Yo recuerdo con gran cariño la fase de las dos torres, aunque había muchas más. Por desgracia este éxito fue el que luego la hizo desaparecer. El juego seguía el esquema de los primeros Doom, un escenario abierto y que el usuario fuera explorando y matando, pero esta vez tendría una IA muy buena, y un aspecto gráfico épico. Otro detalle muy chulo en la época, era los personajes que te podían ayudar y la posibilidad de ver escenarios sin enemigos, sólo explorar y explorar. El argumento del juego es muy simple, eres un prisionero que escapa de la cárcel y vas a acabar a un planeta esclavizado por unos seres muy chungos. Tu intentarás salvar tu vida y de paso, a los seres del planeta. El argumento me recuerda mucho a las películas de los años 60-80, en especial por el final. Como es la versión Gold, el juego trae la expansión Return to Na Pali cuyo argumento os lo dejo a vosotros, y que en el juego no aporta mucho más. Entrando en analizar el juego... pues lo normal sería decir que ha envejecido muy mal y demás al ser del 1998 (N64/DC), pero yo creo que esto no es así. El juego muestra una IA y un diseño de fases que bien les gustaría tener a los juegos actuales (2016), y si bien el motor está desfasado, muestras luces y ciertos efectos muy punteros para la época. El juego es duro de jugar hoy en día, pero después de estar 30 horas con el nuevo Doom, necesitaba algo calmado y de exploración, por lo que creo que me gusto tanto por esto.

29176407.review:
Unreal é um jogo de FPS desenvolvido pela Epic Games em maio de 1998. Seu nome é derivado do motor gráfico Unreal Engine e foi relançado como Unreal Gold, um pacote que incluia a Mission Pack I: Return to Na Pali e uma série de atualizações. O enredo narra a aventura de um prisioneiro (no jogo vc cria o personagem) que é liberto após a nave em que estava preso, a Vortex Rikers, cair em um planeta desconhecido, logo se descobre que a nave foi atacada por uma raça alien que invadiu esse planeta e o jogador deve escapar dele. A jogabilidade é ótima até para os dias de hoje, rápida e fluída, como todo bom shooter old school, tem uma boa variedade de armas, cada arma tem tiros e munições diferentes. A Inteligência Artificial do jogo é muito boa pra época e razoável nos dias de hj, o inimigos vão pra cima quando se está carregando e desviam de projéteis lentos. Os gráficos são magníficos para a época, um verdadeiro baile no motor gráfico da ID Software, até hj é possível se encantar com o design das arquiteturas dos nativos. Os mapas são variados e nunca se repetem, o que deixa o jogo mais incantador e impossível de enjoar. Hà uma grande variedade de inimigos, inclusive o Ice Skaarj lembra muito o predador, teria Unreal inspirado o filme? O multiplayer não testei mas parece que os servidores ainda funcionam, porem vai ser difícil encontrar alguma partida, mas fácil encontrar partidas no primeiro Tournament. A configuração dos controles são o padrão da época, então será necessário configurar quase tudo. Apesar da idade, Unreal gold envelheceu bem e é uma experiência incrível que não deve ser deixada de lado pelos amantes de shooters old school. 

Nota 10/10 Um dos melhores shooters que já joguei <3

+obtížnost
+tzv. level dizajn
+Flak Cannon
+příběh
+běhá na Win 10 64bit (1920x1080)

-místy UI

K Unrealu jen toto. V době kdy vyšel byl považován za hru s nejlepším enginem (ikdyž příznici Quake se na hlavu stavěli, nemohli s tím dělat nic), grafikou, UI, největší délkou, obtížností a hlavně velkou náročností na výkon PC. Za střílečku, kde nebylo rozhodující množství oponentů, jako spíš jejich síla a "chytrost". No a pak přišel HL 1 a vše bylo jinak. :))) Z Unrealu najednou byla v té době až ta druhá "střílečka". Rozhodně nechci snižovat kvality HL, to by si snad nedovolil ani nejvěští herní neznaboh či provokatér. Nicméně pro mě osobně zůstane Unreal takovou mezní FPS. Protože mi dal daleko víc než následně Half-Life. Je to tím, že přesně cílil do prostředí které mě zajímá a příběh samotný mi přišel daleko zajímavější (sorry Freemane:)). Navíc grafika Unrealu mi přišla daleko zajimavější než ta u HL.

Unreal nabídl takový level dizajn, že už nikdy jsem u žádné FPS, co se týká provedení jednotlivých levelů, nekoukal s otevřenou pusou. Prostě mi to po Unrealu už přišlo jako "to už tu bylo v roce 1998". Navíc výtečný a v té době graficky nepřekonatelný engine nabídl úžasnou hru světel a stínů, rozlohu map a jejich úžasné grafické provedení, kdy na to každý a to myslím vážně každý kdo tu dobu pamatuje, koukal jak z jara. Ale ta hra i přes dokonalou grafiku nebyla jen o ní. Příběh byl velmi zajimavý a chytlavý. Souboje s protivníky těžké, ale zároveň férové. Člověk se musel hodně snažit, ale nikdy se necítil znechuceně že to tvůrci s obtížností přehnali. Hra po člověku požadovala i zapojení nějaké té části mozku. 

UNREAL PRO MĚ NAVŽDY ZŮSTANE NEJLEPŠÍ FPS VŠECH DOB - omlouvám se AvP, HL, MoH, CoD, Quaku, Doome, Duku a spoustě dalších ať už nových či starých, JE TO PROSTĚ TAK. 

Škoda, že tvůrci Unrealu, Half-Lifu a AvP se tehdy nespojili a a každý nedodal něco. Unreal prostředí, dizajn levelů, epičnost a obtížnost, Half-Life odladění, UI, absenci většího množství chyb a Aliens vs Predator svoji atmosféru a hrůzu z toho co přijde (v dobrém slova smyslu). Kdyby se tak stalo tak vznikla hra kterou nikdo nikdy nepřekoná. Ale takto vznikly tři úžasné a téměř dokonalé hry, takže je to vlastně asi dobře. :)

Jooo zlatá doba...

28926683.review:
Este juego fue parte importante de mi infancia, lo recuerdo con mucha emocion, pero tiene muchos problemas.

En su tiempo este juego fue un digno rival de quake 2 y en general fue una propuesta inovadora y el diseño de algunos niveles es bueno, pero la accion no es tan fluida como en quake. 


[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
[*]Inmensos niveles para explorar
[*]una variedad considerable de armas
[*]El diseño de niveles es muy variado, puedes estar en un templo inca y dos niveles despues puedes estar en una nave espacial o en castillo medieval
[*]En su momento, fue un juego graficamente impecable, con su motor de fractales y sus efectos de luz, parecia insuperable
[*] Soporta resoluciones Widescreen de 1080 o mas
[*] Alguno niveles son muy originales y complejos
[*] Es un juego extenso, la campaña principal te llevara 10 horas o mas
[/list]


[h1]Contras[/h1]
[list]
[*]Las armas tratan de ser muy originales y al final no funcionan como deberian en medio del combate, porque la cadencia de disparo es lenta, y en lugares abiertos los enemigos esquivan muy facil las balas y las armas que agregaron en la expansion se sienten echas al vapor y mal implementadas
[*]Algunos niveles son verdaderos laberintos o innecesariamente gigantes y a vecescuando activas algun swicht parece que no hay nada que te diga que puerta se abrio.
[*]A pesar que la lista de enemigos es variada, cuando estas en el juego solo aparecen dos o tres enemigos diferentes,  a veces la unica diferencia es que son mas grandes o con una armadura.
[*]Recuerdo que en su momento el diseño de los niveles eran genial, ahora los veo como un poco vacios y muy poligonales.
[*]El buscar un swich que abra una puerta puede ser frustante
[*]no hay malo mas molesto que las arañas
[*]La expansion de Return to Na pali es muy corta, y las armas nuevas no aportan nada nuevo, pero en general no es malo
[/list]

28170814.review:
You start the game off as a prisoner...no this is not ElderScrolls.
Its not made clear what you are imprisoned for. Assault, murder, genocide, jaywalking? Who knows.
 
During the prisoners transport, the spacecraft crashes onto the planet Na Pali.
The natives (Nali) are non hostile. They help you find secrets if you keep them alive.
But they have been invaded and are being tormented by an evil race. 
And you may or may not be their savior, their “Messiah” 

You dont have much of an objective. You're basically exploring this planet. 
Locations vary. There are indoor and outdoor locations.
Outdoor is better since you are able to dodge enemy projectiles easier. Also its brighter and more colorful.
The transition from level to level feels natural and makes sense. There is an actual sense of progression. It wont feel like its just a bunch of random levels one after the other.
This game's level design and variety puts today's games to shame.

Enemies take a lot of hits and require a lot of dodging. 
The enemies themselves also dodge your attacks.
The weapons vary.

Its amazing how such an old game (1998) still holds up today.
This is helped by, of course, unofficial patches and mods.

NEGATIVES: 
-Getting through some levels the first time can be hard because of the graphics some areas do look alike.
-Other than a a stained glass image of Vandora Goddess of Lightning, there are no female models of the Nali. Reminds me of the lack of female models in Half Life also released in 1998. This game has other similarities with Half-Life (this is a good thing not a bad thing). But they are still 2 different games.

28136315.review:
This is the game that, in my childhood, turned the knob of my appreciation of games to max and is still my favorite to date. Of course, this is best played 10 years ago when the athmosphere and graphics innovations were going to blow your mind, but it holds up very respectably still with a couple of community patches and high-res texture packs. The level design is amazing and it can gift you a bouquet of experiences, ranging from fear, mystery, to awe because of the beautifully crafted unexplored alien world. The soundtrack by one Alexander Brandon (also the music author of most of UT's soundtrack and Deus Ex) is truly a masterpiece and I regularly come back to it on youtube when I want something athmospheric to listen to. Besides Half-Life, you won't find a game with a more original arsenal at your disposal, and the enemies you will encounter feel like actual intelligent creatures - they will hide or will dodge your projectiles and close the distance to rip you a new one. I dare you to play on the highest difficulty, where two melee hits from anyone are enough to kill you. 
Man, I can talk for ages about Unreal. But you better just try it yourselves. Make sure you patch it right - there are enough guides out there on how to do that. And enter its world with respect - this is a very old game, but it will reward SO MUCH you once you let it in.

27733008.review:
It doesn't have a combat as good as other FPS games from the 90s, or the best plot ever, but that doesn't stop Unreal from being one of the best games released in 1998.

It was a technical masterpiece back in the day, and while the graphics are dated in this day and age, the game still manages to look good, with well placed lighting and colors, but most importantly, the world of Na Pali still retains a good atmosphere, and a sense of wonder as you explore ancient ruins and hi-tech starships.

The level design is what you would normally see in other FPSes from the time. Complex layouts that give with little to no directions, which allows for heavy exploration as well as a lot of oportunities to get lost, although some are more linear and don't really leave any room for confusion. Not the most consistant level design, but it works.

There are some other interesting details, like an AI that was quite advanced for the time, and a device that lets you read logs from dead humans as well as ancient messages in temples, among other things.

TL;DR: Atmosphere and environments are its strong point, and it manages to keep the old school FPS formula without feeling like a reskinned version of older titles.

26555245.review:
[h1] Unreal - живая легенда[/h1]

[i]Сложно переоценить вклад в жанр шутеров, какой внесла Unreal... Этакий Doom(я имею ввиду Doom 2016 года) своего времени. Фантастическая на тот момент графика, AI настолько крутой, что даже сейчас может потягаться с новинками игровой индустрии. А музыкальное сопровождение, сюжет, геймплей... Ладно, обо всем по порядку. [/i]

Unreal это игра, которая в чем-то опередила свое время. Именно она дала нам тот самый движок, на котором сейчас десятками пишутся игры. Именно она была первой игрой с такой детализированной и прорисованной графикой. Именно Unreal, наравне с Quake создали такой жанр как Deathmatch.

В этой игре все великолепно. Здесь нет огромного количества врагов. Но каждый противник опасен и умен, т.к. AI у мобов очень продвинутый, даже по современным меркам. А чего стоят эти пейзажи, которые прекрасно передают атмосферу планеты, на которую попадает ГГ. Геймплей же очень нелинеен, часто можно заблудиться на локациях. А музыкальное сопровождение отлично слушается и не надоедает. И это все, напомню, в 1998 году!

Игре скоро будет 20 лет с момента выпуска, а она все такая же потрясающая и великолепная. Мало игр есть, которые хочется иметь в библиотеке и проходить время от времени. Это одна из них. [i]И не смотрите, что у меня тут мало часов, я до стима я ее проходил кучу раз)[/i].

Вначале был Unreal... Игра классика и законодатель жанра. Непревзойденный шедевр. Тут даже оценку не буду ставить, ибо Unreal должна быть в библиотеке у каждого уважающего себя любителя шутеров.

26534158.review:
О, великий символ эпически эпичнейшего эпика, экшона и графона(по тем временам). Эта игра она просто офигенна! Она шутер, но в ней есть атмосфера и просто очешуительная музыка которая так и заставляет пустить слезу от ностальгии. Эта игра наполнена адреналином и похвальным шароебством по огромным локациям(это будет нормой если вы заблудитесь на время больше чем на час). Скажу точно про адреналин, каждый бой не даст вам расслабиться и заставит вас думать и быть крайне осторожным, ибо скаржи которых тут чуть больше чем дофига не прощают вам никаких ошибок. Оружия много, оно разнообразно и тонко сбалансировано. В этой игре есть мультиплеер и ботмачи с туевой хучей карт. Боты в мультиплеере это нечто, они реально хитрожопы и заскиллены(простите меня, но по моему мнению Хан из первого турмача нервно курит в сторонке). Акробатика персов в этой игре-это просто аццки эпично, охереть как они сделали это в 1998 в игре такого жанра?

26511041.review:
I'm a big unreal tournament fan, so I bought the unreal pack and got this along with it. I looked at it without much interest and said "what the hey, I'll give it a go".

I AM SO GLAD I DID.

The Pros:
+ The level design is mind boggling. The developers put an excruciating amount of detail into each level (of which there are quite a lot). While progression is linear, the maps are so big and complex with lots of secrets to find that it feels like a first person exploration game at times.
+The soundtrack is beautiful. there are a full 3 hours of full game soundtrack, and each level gets its own unique track. Its too bad that the OST isnt included as a downloadable DLC with this game.
+The gun play in this game is what spawned the rise of Unreal Tournament. It's tight, It's fast paced, It's intense, no BS.

The Mehs:
=There's not much to the story, and what there is can only be found out through data logs left behind by dead crew members or through translations of alien text. The story in the Return to Na Pali expansion is better explained as it gets actual voice acting.

The Cons:
-Wonky things start to happen if you try to run this game higher than its native resolution of 800x600. When you do get it to work, the hud doesnt scale up, meaning that you'll be squinting at the corner of the screen trying to read the ten pixel display that is your ammo count.

26476085.review:
Unreal is basically my favourite game of all time. Levels range from enclosed to outdoor and many intermediate areas inbetween and I obviously encourage anyone to buy Unreal. This version of Unreal (Unreal Gold) comes equipped with the official expansion pack - Return to Na Pali. I don't think return to na pali is quite as good and as long as the main game, but it is still a relatively decent experience none the less.

What I mainly like about Unreal is the extensive content creation capabilities, you can basically create new anything with this game such as worlds/maps, models, skins, textures, sounds, weapons, items, music and mods as the game comes packed with the developer tools, which have been expanded upon with the 227 patch, which also fixes almost every issue with the game, improves performance, adds new capabilities for content creation, adds new tech (such as character shadows) and some supplementary new effects. The patch, created with the permission of Epic games, can be found in the downloads section of www.oldunreal.com , it is sort of compulsary to obtain and install the patch otherwise multiplayer is inaccessable since the gamespy shut down (which shut down the gamespy master servers for multiplayer games), and the patch also updates Unreal to connect to the new masterserver. Multiplayer also allows a hotlink to custom created content, which can be downloaded from that server on the spot simply by connecting to it, over Unreal itself. This means it is very easy to create custom content and share it just by adding it to your server, this is a feature that alot of games from this era (including most games in the current generation) do not have, as usually mods for such games must be downloaded outside of the game + placed and configured in the correct folders, which then afterwoods you can connect to a server if you have done all that correctly, unlike Unreal which downloads everything over the game just by connecting to a server, and runs it from the cache + is already configured.

The 227 patch is actively updated, so new iterations of the patch will come out subsequently, adding more capabilities and more features.

If you haven't experienced Unreal yet, I urge you to. It's always nice to see new faces in the community!

Edit : Also nominated Unreal Gold for the 'Test of Time' steam award.

[u]What I liked about the game[/u] 

•	Very impressive level design. Na Pali is a beautiful place to explore, especially were there is lots of vegetation and waterfalls. There are levels were you can explore space ships, native villages and ancient temples. The game still looks good today. 
•	Interesting story.   
•	Awesome soundtrack, especially at the beginning.  
•	Plenty of secrets to be found, some are hidden in quite clever places. 
•	A great selection of weapons. My favourite weapons were the Stinger and the ASMO.

•	Intelligent A.I. Some of the enemies are hard to kill because of there agility.

[u]What I disliked or was disappointed with[/u]

•	 I wish the player had a permanent flashlight, one in which recharges, instead of having to keep finding flares and flashlights throughout the game. I had to fire my gun to light up some areas in the game.  
•	I didn't find the power ups very useful. I very rarely used them.
•	The game can be confusing sometimes. I got stuck a couple of times not knowing were to go or what to do.

I really enjoyed Unreal, like I said very impressive level design. It's a beautiful world to explore. If you like games like quake 2 and half-life I highly recommend you buy this. 81/100

25693964.review:
Prepare yourself for one of the greatest FPS games of all time, alongside Doom and Duke Nukem 3D.

Unreal puts you in the shoes of Prisoner 849, an otherwise nameless character with no dialogue or emotion, who was a prisoner on the prison ship Vortex Rikers that crash landed on the planet Na Pali.

You emerge from the crashed ship and take a gander at the vivid detail of the amazing landscape around you.  Fight your way through tough enemies that can appear from anywhere just to find out what happened to the rest of the crew and what your options for survival are.  As you progress through the world you learn more about what happened to everyone and how far they made it, what happened to the planet natives, and who the alien invaders are and what they want.  Gather new weapons and discover the right tool for the job as you face new and bigger enemies.  You'll quickly find out that some weapons have the ability to completely explode an enemy, sending body parts flying and bouncing with a trail of blood, while others can sever limbs with the same outcome.

When you finish the game and discover your final outcome you have the pleasure of going back and playing again on harder difficulties.  Harder difficulties not only make the enemies stronger and your weapons weaker, the enemies are faster, come in greater numbers, and (my favorite) they become SMARTER.  Smarter, meaning they hide, ambush, fake their deaths, and mislead you down the wrong path.

The multiplayer aspect is much appreciated.  Play online (if the servers are still running) or go against the computer in a botmatch and make the match you want to play, with maps inspired by levels from the main story.

Built back in 1998 on the brand-new Unreal Engine the game takes your breath away with amazing detail and a breath-taking score to compliment the variety of environments throughout the game.  Customize your controls with action-mapping and fine-tuning sensitivity, while also changing the HUD to need your desired style.

The only downside to this game is the lack of detail and textures when you get up close to an object or environment wall.  According to an interview with developers, this was the result of a time and budget constraint.  Just imagine what they could have accomplished without those constraints and how different our games would be today.  Many games and development companies use a variant of the original Unreal Engine, such as Battlefield, Borderlands, Life is Strange, Duke Nukem Forever, BioShock, Dirty Bomb, and many, many, many more.

I originally got this game not long after it came out and was blown away by everything and immediately fell in love with it.  I would highly recommend this for anyone that is up for a challenge and appreciates old, revolutionary games that changed the way we game today.

24814598.review:
As other reviews of this game have mentioned, Unreal is phenomenal! Of the first person shooters I've played, this one is way better than most. The amazingly rich environments suck you deep into the plight of the peaceful Nali and the cruel world of their oppressors. When you awaken in your cell, you are alone, the bodies of your shipmates bloodied and lifeless. Many are torn in two. Sirens and garbled voice recordings break the uneasy silence, as you crawl through the battered remains of the ship, only to find that you are the sole survivor, lost on a planet full of hostile beings intent on your demise. That is only the beginning, though. Your travels to escape the planet will lead you through many varied locations that are very easy to differentiate from one another, each one more visually stunning than the last. That is definately one of Unreal's strong points. 
The brilliant designers do not allow for the levels to become tediously repetitive. Each environment has it's own personality. Another strong point, and perhaps most important, is the enemy. Long gone are the days of Doom when enemies would simply stand their ground, and trade fire with you. These enemies are much more cunning than that. They will use cover, snipe at you from high perches, duck fire, dodge and even call for back-up if neccessary. Some of your enemies will even try to draw you into traps and ambushes. 
This game is exceptionally challenging and rewarding, making most shooters pale in comparison. I was most impressed with the dramatic lighting, ambient sound and music, utilized to it's full potential, making this lengthy epic bristle with life and tension. This is an ideal purchase for anyone who does'nt already have this classic in their library. You can take or leave the included expansion pack, as it simply doesn't offer much more variety to the original experience, but don't over-look this title due to it's now ridiculously low price. For unparalleled on-line battle, check out Unreal tournament.

24770576.review:
[h1]你从床上醒来，耳边又一次的响起了基地警报声[/h1]

昏暗的走廊，遍地的尸体，诡异凶残的怪物，神秘的异族建筑。
你窝着一肚子的火，用起床气和口径比脑袋还要大的武器进行着种族屠杀。

相比早一年发售，革新了游戏界理念，以剧情和探索元素取胜的的【半条命】。
作为98年最佳主视角射击游戏的【虚幻】显然还保留着第一时期FPS游戏的特色。
见洞就钻，是个按钮就按，十步杀一怪，子弹不上膛的传统设计。
加上硕大的场景，高AI的敌人，丰富多变的武器和动听的音乐。
本作可以说是早期FPS在以【半条命】开创的第二阶段到来的收尾之作。

——————————————————————————————————————

个人对于本作有3个方面觉得极为优秀：
[olist]
    [*]良好的战斗乐趣，本作的敌人数量不算太拥挤。
每场战斗基本上就是1～4个敌人和玩家周旋。
敌人不论是回避攻击还是进攻都十分积极。
双方的火力差距不大，加上优秀的行动思路使得战斗的激励程度很高。
    [*]有趣的武器系统，和【半条命】一样，本作的武器都有两种射击模式。
不过因为其外星球的背景设定，本作中的枪械都比较特别。
和传统FPS中常见的人类”标配“相比是比较新颖的体验。
而且武器还具备一定的升级系统，在得到特定道具后会“进化”
    [*]本作的音乐质量极高，每一首曲子都是制作精良
虽然游戏的演出效果和剧情表现比较薄弱，
但是配合着成熟的场景气氛和应景音乐，
对于还原游戏中的惊悚场面也做得很到位。
[/olist]

————————————————————————————

[quote=百度百科]虚幻引擎3 是由全球顶级游戏EPIC公司虚幻引擎的最新版本，EPIC中国唯一授权机构GA游戏教育基地。是一个面向下一代游戏机和DirectX 9个人电脑的完整的游戏开发平台，提供了游戏开发者需要的大量的核心技术、数据生成工具和基础支持。
[/quote]

这个是直接用百度搜索【虚幻】的结果...............
当年的3大FPS：雷神之锤2、半条命、虚幻
现在这3个各种用自家开发出顶级FPS游戏的公司都还算过的不错。
然而对于只关心游戏的我来说，只剩下了id还保留着过去的精神和开发水平多少还是有些遗憾的。

[spoiler] 一家专心开发全民适用的高效率引擎，好让某些随便用默认素材做个宣传片就喊着做“模拟地球”的骗子众筹。
一家连出个“3”都能变成业界梗，一心坐着游戏社区平台，数钱数到手软。
这不过是一个喜欢古典FPS的过时之人又一次碎碎念罢了XD。
[/spoiler]

————————————————————————————————————————————

[h1] 推荐标签：	[/h1]
[list]
    [*]不负盛名的98年度FPS
    [*]虚幻引擎的业界首秀
    [*]出色的BGM
[/list]
[h1]游玩建议：	[/h1]
[list]
    [*]本作的游戏时长不短，适度体验
    [*]由于没有检查点，需要记得经常手动存档
    [*]觉得子弹不够？[spoiler]游戏中输入“～”打开控制台，输入“allammo”[/spoiler]
[/list]

24657467.review:
I'm playing devils advocate a bit here but bear with me...

I remember being in awe of this game as a kid, especially when I went into my local CEX and they had a dozen PC's running the demo on a loop. The graphics were at the time genuinely amazing. However if I remember back a bit harder I also remember never finishing it, and playing it again now I'm not the least bit surprised.

The level design is poor. If you're of the opinion that the mid - late 90's was the golden age of level design and has subsequently gone downhill then comparing to something contemporary like quake the level design is doubly poor. Storytelling breaks the golden rule of "show don't tell" by being accoumplished through innumerable, slightly-awkward-to-access message dialogues. Enemies are wooden and moronic (again compare to quake, or even doom,) and with the notable exception 1 or 2 well loved weapons (read: flak cannon) these is absolutely nothing here beyond a cookie-cutter shooter. Albeit one that happened to look very pretty at the time.

The whole thing could written off as a glorified tech demo, and unsurprisingly that's what the name "unreal" has come to mean to most gamers, it's an engine, not a game.

Add into the mix the usual retro-gaming bug bears such as no auto save or widescreen support, awkward default key-binds and proprietary surround sound and you have an experience that IMHO it isn't worth going back to. Let fond memories be fond memories.

24605715.review:
久し振りにWin10Pro環境で遊んでみました。
今時のマシンなら軽すぎる位のゲームなので高画質なハイレゾテクスチャーを導入しました。
まずプログラムをアンオフィシャルで最新技術に対応した物に更新します。

1.次のページで「 UnrealGoldPatch227i 」を落として解凍、インストールします。
http://www.oldunreal.com/oldunrealpatches.html

2.インストール先はsteamクラで「Unreal Gold」のプロパティの「ローカルファイルを閲覧」
で確認、指定します。

3.次のページでハイレゾテクスチャーを落として解凍、「Textures」フォルダの中に上書きコピーします。
http://www.unrealtexture.com/Unreal/Website/Downloads/Textures/ExtremeEnd/StockUnreal/UnrealExtremeEnd.htm

4.最初に起動する時はウインドウモードにした方が設定がしやすいと思います。
「System」フォルダのファイル「Unreal.ini」を開いて
「StartupFullscreen=True」を「StartupFullscreen=False」に書き換え、保存します。

5.steamクラから「Unreal Gold」を起動します。
3D video devicesは「Direct3D9」か「OpenGL」を選択する。
sound devicesは上の方が軽く、下の方がよりハードウェア機能を要求します。

6.デモが起動したらESCキーでメニューを開き、「Options」の「Advanced Options」を選択する。
別のウインドウでAdvanced Optionsが開くので「Rendering」のツリーの選択した
3D video devicesを開き、UseS3TCの設定が「True」になっているか確認、
「False」の時はUseS3TCの行をクリックしてカーソルキーで「True」に変更する。

その他は必要に応じて変更する。

最後に「Advanced Options」ウインドウの右上の「X」ボタンをクリックして閉じる。

7.フルスクリーンに変更する場合は一旦、終了した方がいいです。

%「Altキー」+「Enterキー」のスクリーン切り替えだと上手く動かなく場合があります。

メニューの「Game」から「Quit」で一旦、終了する。
「System」フォルダのファイル「Unreal.ini」を開いて
「StartupFullscreen=False」を「StartupFullscreen=True」に書き換え、保存する。

8.steamクラから「Unreal Gold」を起動します。
起動したらESCキーでメニューを開き、「Options」の「Preferences」を選択する。
「Video」タブの「Resolution」を好みの解像度に変更する。
「World Texture Detail」と「Skin Detail」を「High」に変更する。

解像度が高くてメニューの文字が小さい時は「Font Size」を「Double」に変更するといい。

9.後はお好みで設定、「Close」をクリックしてウインドウを閉じる。

10.メニューの「Game」から「New」で遊ぶ。

23852281.review:
If you like cool guns, alien worlds, or really anything to do with sci fi, then look no furhter. Unreal is a beautiful game and not just visually, the lore, music and atmosphere are superb. Enemies are as diveres as the locations you will be exploring, you start off in a prison ship and quickly move onto a mineshaft, a castle, an arena and run down villiages the locals used to live in.
The ship transporting you has crashed into the alien planet inhabited by the Nali, a peacful race that only wants to help you in your quest. Their planet has been over run by Imperialistic Skaarj, a powerful reptilian race wanting only to harvest the Nali homeworld for reasources and will kill anything in their way (i.e. you). 
Unreal is a big game, my first playthrough was around 12+ hours, and thats on the highest difficulty which i 100% recommend to play on, it is so much more satisfying when you beat this game on the highest difficulty. 
As i said before the atmosphere is awesome, there will be times where everything goes silent, your health is low, you are in complete darkness and the flash light is running out of power, and just the idea that there may be an enemy around the corner is absoluty terrifying. Im not going to lie, there have been times where these damn spider like enemies jump out of the wall and i have jumped at the mere hiss they make. 
There has been times where i have gotten stuck but I will just take a break and come back to it later and the answer will be so obvious that i wonder why i didn't think of it before. There are also countless walkthroughs to help you get out of pickles.
Unreal also has botmatches which are always fun to play, and if you have played Unreal tournament '99 then you will see a lot of familiar maps. 
The only thing that i can think of that i didnt like was dying and finding that i didn't save and since it is an old game there is no auto save so it completely your fault if you forget to save. Just shows you how different games are now.

23838890.review:
"Unreal Gold" includes the base game "Unreal", and its mission pack "Return to Na Pali". It also uses the menu from Unreal Tournament, rather than the one from the Unreal disc version.

Today, Unreal could almost be called a hidden gem. It was big back in 1998, but over the years it has somewhat faded into obscurity, at least compared to games like Doom and Quake, which are still widely known and popular. Perhaps this is because Half-Life, a great, but in my opinion inferior game, released at the same time and received vastly more media coverage. Or because the multiplayer version, Unreal Tournament, would become the flagship of Epic Games.

Unreal remains one of the very best single-player FPS to this day. The gameplay could be described as an in-between mix of action-packed shooting (Quake) and atmospheric exploration (S.T.A.L.K.E.R.). The shooting isn't quite as polished and fleshed out as in the id games, but the leveldesign is top-notch. Together with the great music, it creates an immersive atmosphere that's rarely seen in games. Unreal will lead you through so many unique and memorable places over the course of the campaign that it's hard to list them all. You'll explore ancient temples, and it will make you feel as if you were Indiana Jones. You'll also make your way through the decks of a crashed spaceship, and you'll feel just like Ellen Ripley. Add a village in the sky here, an alien mothership there, the leveldesign will take you from one highlight to another.

The arsenal consists of ten weapons and, seeing as this is an older game, you can carry them all. All weapons have two fire modes, while some have additional depth to them, such as the ASMD that can do combos or the 8ball that can load up to six rockets or grenades at once and fire either spread out or close together and even lock on enemies to fire heat-seeking rockets.
All weapons are different from one another, most are interesting and innovative. Unfortunately, they are not balanced. Different weapons have different strengths and weaknesses, but some are outright better than others. The Flak Cannon is a strong counter for the quick and aggressive enemies that like to engage the player in melee combat, and will be your preferred weapon for most encounters as long as you have enough ammo. The more powerful hitscan weapons also pack a good punch and are overall strong and versatile. The most common enemy creature in the game, the Skaarj, is agile and very good at dodging, which makes it a real challenge to inflict meaningful damage with weapons that fire projectiles. Those weapons tend to become easily replaced as your arsenal grows.

Unreal pits you against a number of enemies, from small insects to huge monsters. They really fit into the world and make you believe as if those creatures are actually living there, and not just random mobs placed into the maps by the leveldesigner. Most enemies are distinctively different from one another and require different tactics and weapons to defeat. Each level usually has a prevalent enemy type that makes up most of the population in that area, while the other, general types will take more of a backseat but are still there. The Skaarj, which you'll see throughout the game, come in about a dozen variations with varying stats and skins. Noteable is an AI that is impressive even today, almost two decades later. The pathfinding may let enemies find you even from far away through terrain that is difficult to navigate. Most enemies are reckless when at full health, and cautious when injured. Their ability to lead with projectiles as well as Skaarj's mobility and agility make for a formidable challenge on higher difficulties.

Unreal does have multiplayer, though it's probably hard to find online games after all these years. The multiplayer always seemed to lack [i]something[/i] that ended up making it feel unfinished, though I could never point out exactly what that was. Perhaps it's the weapons which are designed to slay monsters, though they are still potent and perfectly capable of fragging players once you get good at the game. If you want to give multiplayer a more serious try, I'd suggest checking out Unreal Tournament, what's basically a polished version of the multiplayer released as a new game, and the best of its kind only challenged by Quake 3 Arena.
It's also possible to play with bots, and they give inexperienced players a good run for their money. Filling DmFith, DmHealPod or DmMorbias with 16 bots and just reveling in the carnage it would unfold kept me entertained for hours on end in a time when internet access wasn't readily available. It's definitely worth checking out.

I'd also like to mention that, on a technical level, Unreal could quite possibly be [i]the[/i] most impressive game relative to release date, which makes a worthy history lession second only to Wolfenstein 3D. And if you had a 3dfx Voodoo card in 1998 you know exactly why. We were used to playing Duke3D and Quake when Unreal came along with its colored lightning, reflective surfaces, glow effects, volumetric lightning, and and and... it was eyecandy on a level that put Crysis to shame. Even the AI was and still is amazing, only really outdone by F.E.A.R.. And yet Unreal is more than a simple tech demo. It's actually a good game, solid in every aspect. And the first game that earned the right to call itself a "Quake killer". Did it kill Quake? No, but the attempt was more than respectable.

If you like FPS, you'll love Unreal. It's one of the best single-player FPS ever made, and a must-play for any shooting enthusiast. Its leveldesign, music, graphics and AI raised the bar in 1998 and still hold up today.

23647701.review:
I don't even quite know where to begin. I only had gotten the game a few years ago, as an idle curiousity to see the roots of Unreal Engine. I didn't manage to play through the main game the first time, those years ago, but more recently, I had the chance here. I got the OldUnreal patches and everything for the copy here on Steam, which I'm using through family sharing, and this game, this game is fucking amazing. The gameplay is extremely quick and fluid, with a lot of polish for such an old game. Even better, uncapped framerates with custom renderer support, an FOV slider (Although it's easier to control in the .ini file, and also labled Widescreen adjust), and so many cool weapons. Every weapon feels great to use, the sounds have punchiness, the music puts you in a groove, and best of all, it's so much fun. While the game is fast paced, it also has loads of puzzles, nonlinear level designs, and I can't name a single thing it does wrong beside the slightest, tiniest bit of audio crackling in the music. You can only hear it if you're really, really looking for it though.

Oh, and the environments are so vast, that I can't help but feel that they're just gorgeous, despite being low res and low poly.

So, in recap, Unreal does all of these right:
Weapons
Audio
Environmental Audio
MUSIC
Interesting Enemy Design
Interesting Levels
Levels that make you go "woah"
MUSIC
And everything else

GET IT.

This game has by far the most impressive AI I have EVER seen in a game.
Enemies actually feel threatening, and feel like they're actual players fighting you rather than a computer bot. The basic Aliens (Skaarj) will take 3-6 ROCKETS to kill, talk about tough.
They will bunny hop, circle strafe, match your movements, and avoid any projectile based attacks your give and literally dodge out of the way.

Not only the AI, but the level design, music, and satisfying feel of gunplay this game delives gives it the right to be titled "Unreal".
The graphics are kinda bleh by today's standards and it looks like a ps2 game, but this was made way back in 1998, before the ps2 even existed. This was really impressive back then.

Everything in this game is perfect.
nothing even felt repetetive, which is amazing to me because normally games start to feel very repetetive to me throughout the first half of the game.

Only thing I have to complain about is how complex the level design can be, and it can confuse alot of modern gamers because they wouldn't have the gaming instints of older players that know how to explore well.

This is by far one of my all time favorite games, if you haven't played it, I don't know if you've either never heard of any of the unreal games and have been living under a friggin rock or some crap, or you haven't played the very first game that started it all.

I reccomend this to anyone that likes fps. The multiplayer is also amazing, but Unreal Tournament was more polished, though it's multiplayer only.

22695531.review:
Sweet land of liberty, where do I begin?

I've owned this game since I was about five years old (not the best parenting choice, was it?), and I loved it. When I found out it was on Steam, the nostalgia rammed into me like a train.
And it turns out that nostalgia is still hitting me as we speak.
Unreal Gold is essentially a bundle of both the original Unreal (the singleplayer campaign), and Unreal Tournament 99 (the multiplayer and botmatch portion). Both are very enjoyable and nice to come back to every now and again.

As a child, I mostly did botmatches because they were so much fun! There were a variety of gamemodes, weapons, and maps (Radikus and Tundra being my favorites). The gameplay is pretty fast paced, which keeps every match interesting.

In regards to the singleplayer, it is sort of a "figure out where to go by yourself" sort of campaign. I don't know too much of the story, but all I know is that you crash land on a planet and you were apparently a prisoner of some kind.

Plus, the online mode is STILL FUCKING FUNCTIONAL. Holy Jesus this blew my mind when I tried it for the first time. Some servers have mods that change the gameplay entirely, or give you new weapons to toy with. It definitely was worth waiting a minute or so.

In conclusion, if you like aliens, fast paced combat, O.P bazookas, nostalgic environments and violence up the wazzoo, get this game. You won't regret it. (Unless you are a slow-paced shooter playing scrublord. I'm looking at you, C.O.D players.)

22232345.review:
Unreal Gold is an Action FPS game that runs on the original engine of the same name (The Unreal engine). To this day it haunts my dreams with it's large open maps, complex level design, and stunning graphics (for its time). You can't go wrong if you are into older FPS games and this game has always stood out and been unique.

This particular Edition comes with the Return to Na Pali expansion (Which is lower quality imho, but it's still worth a playthrough.)

It features a lot of pretty unique weapons, all designed to show off different aspects of what the engine could do, and they end up being so different that it's actually refreshing. The levels and environments are also varied and interesting. Some of the levels in this game are seriously impressive (I'm looking at you, sunspire). The game is still pretty damn pleasing to look at as well, despite it's lack of polygons and lower res textures, the level design really makes great use of the engine and puts a lot of other 3D shooters of the day to shame.

Where I feel this game really excels above all else, is it's music. It has some of the best video game music I've ever had the pleasure of hearing. Seriously it's an amazing soundtrack, check it out, especially if you like Alexander Brandon.

The game does have a story, but  it's not shoved down your throat. Instead it's told through a universal translator item you obtain near the start of the game, it will pick up various messages from dead bodies, books, computer terminals, and can be read to learn about the world and characters in it. The translator also often tells you what a switch does or provides important clues to progressing (This game can be a bit troublesome to navigate compared to most of the linear games we get these days). 

Return to Na Pali actually has some "cutscenes" that are basically monologue of the main character over a section of the map, these can be skipped and some of them weren't even working for my last playthrough.

So now for the downside, this game has some crashing problems, and by some, I mean a lot! There is a good community made patch that you really should seek out before playing, as it removes a vast majority of the crashes.

tl;dr: Awesome and unique FPS with a lot of variety in weapons and environments and some of the best music I've ever heard.

22209663.review: I used to play this game when I was younger and absolutely LOVED it. And i'm really glad to see that it's on Steam for others to enjoy. And even now i still adore it as much as i did before~

22184388.review:
Unreal Gold включает в себя оригинальный Unreal и дополнение Return to Na Pali. 
Сама игра - FPS старой школы, с очень интересным оружием, врагами и локациями. Обо всём по порядку.

Сюжет: Вы - безымянный заключённый, которого перевозят на каком-то космическом корабле. Он терпит крушение на планете На Пали, населённой порабощёнными четырёхрукими аборигенами. Захватили её злобные пришельцы, очень похожие на Хищников - Скаарджи. Главная задача - к чертям выбраться с этой планеты, попутно уничтожая монстряков. На первый взгляд, сюжет ни о чём, но в игре есть очень много дневников аборигенов, людей и самих захватчиков. Из записей можно узнать много интересной информации. Например, аборигены постоянно говорят о неком Избранном, который спасёт их(ГГ, естественно). Дополнение является прямым продолжением сюжета.

Сеттинг: Игра обладает очень разнообразными и стильными локациями, населёнными различной фауной. Хоть и графика устарела, они всё равно очень красивые. Мы побываем на больших открытых пространствах, в замках, гробницах, городах, деревнях, на футуристичных базах и космических кораблях. Музыка просто великолепна.

Геймплей: Просто вишенка этой игры, самый что ни на есть главный её плюс. Очень разнообразное и интересное оружие, ни одной бесполезной пушки. И у каждой по два режима стрельбы. Оружие очень необычное, только три вида из десяти стреляют пулями. Помимо офигетельного оружия, в игре очень интересные враги, которые берут не числом, а своей универсальностью. Просто идти вперёд не получится, так как даже самый рядовой монстр способен убить игрока. К каждому нужно находить свою тактику. Восстановить здоровье можно при помощи бинтов (+1), аптечек (+20) и фруктов (+29). Также можно найти сферу, которая даёт 100 хп поверх имеющегося, то есть максимальное кол-во здоровья - 200. В игре много видов брони, которая надевается независимо друг от друга. Ещё можно найти пояс, который полностью поглащоет получаемый урон. Единственное, что вызывает недовольство - это изредка очень запутанные уровни. Всего на игру их штуки две(из тридцати). Оба являются тёмными гробницами-лабиринтами. В дополнении добавили три вида оружия(из обычных шутеров: автомат, гранатомёт и ракетница) и четыре вида монстров.

Таким образом, Unreal Gold - обязательная для ознакомления всем поклонникам жанра, Игра обладает очень интересным геймплеем и красивым сеттингом,

I'm a big fan of the Tournament series so when I saw this in the Steam Xmas sale I decided to give it a try. And this went straight to my all-time favorites list. A true masterpiece still after 18 years.

Perfect atmosphere, great level design, fantastic soundtrack, well designed fast-paced combat with the always so great Unreal series weaponry. No excessive cutscenes, no overly linear levels or invisible walls, no commanders constantly telling you what to do during the next minute. Just you and a bunch of weapons, fighting the endless stream of different enemies and trying to figure what the heck is going on in this mysterious alien world. There's just nothing especially wrong with this game. Of course the graphics do not quite match today's games, but for a 1998 game they look excellent. I bought this for about 2 euros but this is well worth the normal price of 10 euros.

21832755.review: I got lost in the mothership

21806030.review: Unreal Gold is simply one of the best First Person Shooters that I've ever played. Unreal Gold is an updated version of Unreal, which was released in 1998 among other FPS classics. Unreal is pretty much what happened when Epic Games looked at Quake 2 and said "Yeah that's good and all, but what if we did that, with awesome graphics (for the time), exelent lighting, a unique weapon lineup, and an amazing soundtrack?" And from that, Unreal was born. In Unreal, you go around from map to map (which are generally really huge), fighting an alien race known as the Skarjj, while occasionally helping out another alien race known as the Nali. Unreal has amazing variety in the themes of levels, one minute you're in a crashed prison ship, the next you're in a mountain area, and then the next you're in a mine, and it keeps going on, introducing new and varied areas. Unreal also has an amazing soundtrack, who it's composer would later work on games like Deus Ex. I love the soundtrack in this game, as it has inspired other soundtracks from games that arn't even in the same genre (Freedom Planet for example). The graphics have aged decently. While the texture quality and low poly enviorments and NPCs look bad by today's standards, the lighting in this game is absolutely amazing, and puts other games with great lighting like System Shock 2 to shame. Unreal also has AI which is extremely impressive, even to this day, that almost moves around like another player at times. Unreal's biggest strength however, lies in it's unique weapon lineup, which inclueds the Upgradable Energy Pistol, The Razorjack, The Bio Launcher, and The Flak Cannon to name a few of the awesome weapons. If I had to choose a favorite weapon, it would probably be the Flak Cannon, as it gives a satisfying punch to when you shoot an enemy at point blank. I don't have too many problems with this game to be honest. If I had to nitpick any problems, it would probably be that you do move a bit too slow for my liking, and that sometimes these maps can be extremely confusing to first time players. I also really didn't like the Return To Na Pali expansion included, as many of the changes made to it break the fundamentals of Unreal, and it just doesn't hold up too well. If you like old school FPS games, then Unreal Gold is a game that you should play before you die. I highly reccomend patching the game with The OId Unreal patch, that fixes many bugs the game had, and allows you to run the game in modern resolutions. It's completely Unreal that a first person shooter like is this awesome. If you're a fan of Old School first person shooters, or even FPS games in general, then I reccomend you check this one out. Long Live Nal-Pali

21745042.review:
[h1]Historical Contrast to it's Peers[/h1]
It is no surprse that back in the day Unreal was lauded along with the original halflife.  Sadly this game has aged about as well as the original quake. I.e. Not very well. THe graphics are still pretty nice but the lack of variance in scenarios and interations  leaves one feeling a bit fatigued after a while. There is little room, reason or reward for the stealthy approach and everything but The Nali want to kill you.

[b]PROS[/b]
- Good graphics
- Polished mechanics
- Good level design.

 This game was a little ahead of its time and does a wonderful job of creating the feeling of a big m interconnected world. It certainly beats Half-Life in so far as the variety of the locations. It's a pity they feel so sterile.


[b]CONS[/b]
- Poor pacing
- Visceral satisfaction is low.
- The Na'li

Visceral satisfaction is a weird thing. You know like how in DOOm you never seem to get tired of liquifying a bunch of imps.  Yeah.. Nothing like that here. I seldom if ever found felt satisfied after beating a mini boss or enemy rush. Relieved. , yes. But never satisfied. The fights and enemies are just a bit too annoying. I found greater satisfaction in completing the environmental challenges than I did the combat.

Then there's the Na'li. Every time you see one of these suicidal gits your heart will sink because they are just so  helpful. They will often unlock secret and otherwise inaccessible rooms with nice items and they are so eager to do it they klose all survival instincts.  Get too close and they will begin to run pell mell for theyr stash and invariably right into a group of enemies that are a;ll to happy to kill them. Unless you generously run ahead and absorb the attacks with your sturdy organs.. So every time these guys show iup you're in for an escort mission at high speed. If you're lucky you can snheak around the Na'li, run ahead and clear out the enemnies  before triggering the sprint but other times you have no choice but to try your best to sprint ahead and absorb bullets.

Honestly it is a good game but I can see why Half-Life and Quake surpassed it as far as siingle player and narrative.

21504287.review: In 1998, Epic Games brought us the original Unreal. The game was unlike anything PC gamers had seen before, it had innovative weapons, beautiful graphics (for the time), and a very complex story that some people thought was boring, while others found it worthy of a literature adaptation. But with Unreal Gold, you can experince this game in the way it was truly ment to be played. This package not only contains a slightly modified version of the original 1998 game, but it also contains an expansion pack that practically continues the story of the original Unreal game, this expansion pack goes by the name of The Return to Na Pali. In all seriousness The Return to Na Pali is a really good expansion pack (albeit shorter than the original game) that contains new weapons, enemies, and levels (obviously). I must warn you that the original Unreal and The Return to Na Pali are quite possibly the hardest FPS games you will ever play in your life. Seriously, there were some levels in these games in which I died more than 10 times.  But don't let the difficulty scare you, Unreal Gold is a compilation that every FPS game fan should have in their possesion. This compilation is totally......UNREAL!!!!  P.S. This game contains realistic violence and gore. Gamer discretion is strongly advised.

21225246.review:
I like to blame this game for ruining my childhood as it came with the first computer my family purchased and thus sealed my fate as a gamer for years to come. 

I remember opening the box and hooking up my Gateway 2000 and installing Unreal. It was one of the earliest forms of awe I can recall when I was navigating through the wreckage of the prison ship and going outside onto an alien planet to confront brutes and skaarj and all the other nasty crap. The story was pretty neat, the graphics, at the time, were awesome. The mechanics were, and still are, pretty solid. This series, including the follow up Unreal Tournament, were easily one of my favorite games to play as a child and experiencing it again as an adult took me down nostalgia avenue and socked me right in the feels. 

The action, again, feels smooth and the fights all feel pretty visceral as you blow your enemies to chunks. The environment is as much fun to look at as it is deadly because among being a great FPS it's also got some decent platformer elements combined with some slight puzzle solving areas. Keep in mind none of this is really too difficult but some secret areas can be accessed for more loot or plasma pistol upgrades which really go a long way to making the end game less difficult. As you go through the levels you will find data pads or letters or messages that sort of reveal parts of the story as well as adding some depth to some of the weird scenes you come across. Bodies laying around a room full of guns or some lone crates with chunks of what used to be people beside it tell a story which really adds a lot of immersion to your playthrough.

My only real issue with the game is that some of the graphical settings don't seem to really work but this could just be my machine. Brightness and screen size seem to be constant issues. The only setting that seems to work without issues is 800x600 which is fine, but since I can't really adjust the brigthness level and it seems too dark. Minor gripe for a great classic game.

21084366.review: Unreal - to po polsku znaczy "nierealny", "nierzeczywisty". I taka też ta gra była w momencie, kiedy się ukazała. I to z wielu powodów. Najbardziej oczywisty to grafika, która w tamtych czasach wyciskała wszystkie soki z ówczesnych komputerów. Po drugie to klimat. Na ten aspekt składało się też kilka czynników. Po pierwsze to projekty poziomów ze szczególnym uwzględnieniem dużych otwartych lokacji. Po drugie to muzyka, która po dziś dzień jest mistrzostwem samym w sobie. Po trzecie to tempo rozgrywki. I nie chodzi o to, że było zawrotne. Wręcz przeciwnie. Jest nieśpieszne. Owszem, są momenty, gdy akcja przyśpiesza. Unreal jednak umiejętnie je nam mieszał. To wszystko razem sprawiało, że czasami miało się ochotę rzucić giwery w kąt i położyć się na trawce pod gołym niebem i delektować się widokami. Następną rzeczą wyróżniającą Unreala na tle podobnych gier z tamtej epoki jest fabuła. Tutaj nie była ona tylko pretekstem do mordowania przeciwników. Historia stanowiła ważny element rozgrywki. Rzecz ma miejsce w odległej przyszłości, kiedy to ludzkość od dawna już odbywa podróże międzygalaktyczne. Nasz bohater lub bohaterka jest więźniem i przebywa na statku transportującym jego i innych więźniów na księżyc więzienny. Statek dostaje się jednak w bardzo silne pole grawitacyjne niezidentyfikowanej planety i nie mogąc z niego uciec, rozbija się na rzeczonej planecie. Nasz(a) bohater(ka) przeżywa katastrofę i od tej chwili jego(jej) nadrzędnym celem jest wydostanie się z planety. Kłopot w tym, że planeta zamieszkana przez pokojowo nastawionych czterorękich kosmitów rasy Nali jest pod okupacją wojowniczej i okrutnej rasy kosmitów zwanych Skarrj i ich sojuszników. Nali są wykorzystywani do niewolniczej pracy w kopalniach ważnego dla Skarrj minerału zwanego taridium, w którego złoża planeta jest bogata. Ciemiężeni Nali oczekują przybycia przysłanego przez ich bogów mesjasza, który ich uwolni spod jażma Skarrj i przywróci pokój na ich planecie. I tak się niefortunnie składa, że to wlaśnie nas uważają za swojego wybawiciela. Często jest tak, że napotkani po drodze Nali składają nam pokłony albo chcą, abyśmy za nimi poszli, i jeśli nie napotkamy Skarrja, który w pierwszej kolejności zabije Nalego, po czym weżmie się za nas, to ten Nali otworzy nam skrytkę z przydatnymi przedmiotami. Następnym elementem, który wyróżniał Unreala wśród gier z tamtego okresu była inteligencja przeciwników, głównie tych Skarrjów. Skubańce żwawo uskakiwały przed naszymi strzałami, celowały z wyprzedzeniem w miejsce, w którym dopiero mieliśmy się znaleźć, wykonując unik, a nawet potrafiły.........udawać trupa, żeby potem nas zajść od tyłu. Dziś to wszystko nie brzmi może tak niezwykle, ale wtedy takie było. W końcu dochodzimy do aspektu długości gry. Dzisiejsze CoD-y i inne mogą się schować ze swoimi 5-godzinnymi kampaniami przy singlowej kampanii Unreala, która była naprawdę długa(zresztą w tamtych czasach singlowe kampanie w grach nie były traktowane po macosemu, tak jak to ma miejsce dziś, a takie durnoty, jak gry przeznaczone tylko do multi były rzadkością. Zawsze bardziej przedkładałem ciekawe kampanie singlowe nad fragowanie się z innymi i wysłuchiwanie, jaki to ze mnie noob czy inna lama. Zresztą według znawców tryb multi to była jedyna rzecz, w której Unreal słabował, więc aby naprawić ten "błąd" gry powstała oddzielna seria, Unreal Tournament). Do gry ukazał się dodatek, który może nie był specjalnie długi, ale jednak trochę wydłużał tę przygodę. I jedno, czego naprawdę szkoda, to to, że ta gra nie doczekała się kontynuacji z prawdziwego zdarzenia, bo to, co ukazało się pod tytułem Unreal 2: The Awakening jako gra nie było może rewelacyjne, ale też nie było takie znowu tragiczne, ale jako kontynuacja tego Unreala było po prostu tragiczną porażką.

20724838.review:
Летняя распродажа. Вижу как мои друзья заходят в третий Unreal Tournament. Вспомнилось, как клёво когда-то проводил время в UT 2004 и решил сыграть с ними. Не пожалел денег на пак, так как очень люблю проходить игры, начиная с первой части и до последней, наблюдая развитием всей серии.
Признаться, с этой игрой пришлось немного разбираться. Unreal на фоне современных (и не очень) игр выглядит очень необычно. Не сразу понял как использовать инвентарь. Какое-то время подстраивал под себя управление. Временами не ясно, что именно от тебя требуют. Но минут через 30 въехал и понеслась.
Первое, что для себя отметил - это саундтрек. Радовал на протяжении почти всей игры. Если не изменяет память, для каждого уровня подобрано по несколько треков. Михиль ван ден Бос и Александр Брэндон отлично постарались. Кстати, когда слушал  треки Михиля, записанные совместно с метал-группой Oblivion Machine на их альбоме Viewpoint Collector, мысленно снова вернулся в игру.
Второе - обалденные для того времени пейзажи и ночное небо. Временами останавливался посреди игры и любовался. Эти первые два пункта являются фундаментом атмосферы игры, которая здесь на высшем уровне.
Третье - враги. Мало того, что они все разные внешне и по стилю боя, так в добавок ещё чертовски умные. Они притворяются мёртвыми, уворачиваются от снарядов, некоторые имеют половину твоего арсенали и включают бессмертие. Последний раз противники меня так восхищали во времена первого F.E.A.R. Как итог - перестрелки становятся интересными.
Стоит отметить, игра не проходится на одном дыхании. Уровней очень много и часто не ясно, куда именно требуется идти. Заблудиться как нефиг делать. Честно скажу, без прохождений первую часть не осилил. Восхищаюсь теми, кому они не понадобились. У этих людей стальные яйца. Тут же добавлю, локации вполне разнообразны.
После этой игры осталось приятное "послевкусие". Периодически мысленно к ней возвращаюсь, как бывает после прочтения хорошей книги или просмотра интересного фильма. Понравилось намного больше, чем серия игры с припиской Tournament. Не ожидал в 2015-м такого эффекта от игры, которая младше меня на каких-то три года. Всем, кто желает сыграть в шутер с непривычным геймплеем, рекомендую.

20576613.review:
Unreal is a very difficult (provided you play on the later difficulties) and classic FPS from the late 90s. The AI in Unreal and Unreal Tournament 1999 is very advanced, as they become better at dodging rockets and predicting your own movements, which means they'll aim their rockets and other projectiles not directly at you (at least not 100% of the time), but where you're headed, with surprising accuracy. The AI is actually better than most people I've seen play FPSs, and not because their accuracy and HP stats were raised 200% like most games. You, as the player, are also able to use agile dodging moves like the enemies you face. Because of this, and the fact the levels are very large with plenty of secret areas to explore, and a ton of inventory items and weapons to find, Unreal is very fun to play. The graphics are great, and the music is, too. It has most of the same composers as Deus Ex and Unreal Tournament 1999 (obviously).
If you're one of the people who likes a bit of story in their games, Unreal offers a lot of that in the form of a universal translator the player can use to read alien texts and carvings, while also reading the diaries of humans also stranded on the planet you're on.

Music: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1xMp0fZiJaM

Overall, the game is excellent, and for the $10 price tag, you'd be silly not to pick it up.

20503917.review:
[b]Intro[/b]
Unreal Gold is [b]the definitive[/b] first-person shooter and sadly overlooked by other lesser FPS games of 1998 as well as other genre defining classics. This game stands heads and shoulders above all other shooters with a believeable and intriguing world, easily some of the best design in gaming history, incredible sound design with a killer soundtrack and some seriously fantastic visuals that more than hold up 20 years later.

[b]The Great[/b]:
++Not only did this look visually stunning for the year in contrast to everything else, as well as introducing an engine that would go to run some of the best games ever released (i.e. Deus Ex, UT99, Rune) the game looks fantastic today with some really impressive lighting and colourful landscapes.
++Alexander Brandon and Michiel van den Bos' work on the soundtrack is honestly half of the game. The music provides such an incredibly otherworldy atmosphere and provides some of the best music ever heard in a video game. No exaggeration.
++The sound design is rivaled only by Thief the Dark Project when it was released. Mixed with OpenAL, it adds to some really believable environments with realistic high quality sounds that suit the games atmosphere.
++Unreal's multiplayer may have been made redundant by Unreal Tournament but the game features some great experimental maps and includes bots, which were very uncommon for a PC shooter back in the day as well as lots of options and game modes.
++There's a reason the weapon array of this game has gone largely unchanged through every iteration of the series, including the latest released in progress since 2014. The weapon array is probably the best I've ever had the joy of using. Every single weapon is useful and each one suits a given task but not only that, the sound design offers some meaty feeling weapons on the more realistic side but also makes the more sci-fi weapons feel great and bassy. These weapons were entirely original as well. The majority of these weapons are stuff you really just won't find anywhere else.
++The level design is this games biggest strength. The utterly gigantic expanses of land and breath-taking views and vista's add to the feeling that you really are on a foreign planet. Everything is so interesting
++This game has a pretty unique way of handling story providing most of it through your handy translator. This provides back-story as well as information on how to continue your journey in a believable way. The game is also one of the few I've played that is entirely seamless. It feels like a journey from start to finish and everything connects naturally.
++Enemy design is interesting and thoroughly varied. This game also boasts to having some of the best AI ever, and to this day, that's still true.

[b]The Good[/b]:
+The games engine holds up well on modern PC's as long as you use DirectX9. Getting the fan-made 227i patch also helps as well allowing high resolutions and a FOV slider, as well as a bug list too numerous to mention, and more.
+The game is long, really, really long. This isn't a bad thing because the pacing is so fantastic and the gameplay is so refined you'll never feel bored. This is actually a big strength. It also means lots of replayability.
+Multiplayer options are great and online multiplayer is still supported through the 227i patch. The server browser is really well done.
+The game gets better and better as it goes, which is saying something with such a breathtaking intro.
+Movement is fluid and easy and the games unique dodging ability is helpful and adds another layer of depth.
+The game is challenging without ever feeling unfair or atificial. Enemies aren't bullet sponges on the hardest difficulty. (Note: The 227i patch offers a few more harder difficulties harder than the default games hardest. These difficulties have a big problem of bullet sponging enemy types. The original games hardest (Very Hard) does not.)
+Return to Napali is decent

[b]The Okay/Not Too Big of a Deal[/b]:
+-The level design may be the games biggest strength, but sometimes with so many levers being pulled I'm not always entirely sure how I even progressed in the first place. You will get stuck sometimes in these large environments, but honestly it's not so much of a big deal for it to really be an issue.

[b]The Bad[/b]:
-N/A (Note: This isn't even my favourite game ever and yet it's still the only game I have no cons for)

[b]The Horrible[/b]:
--N/A

Sound: 10/10
Graphics: 10/10
Gameplay: 10/10
Content/Replayability: 10/10
Overall: 10/10

Awards:
Runner-Up Game of the Year - 1998
Best FPS of All Time
Best Soundtrack of All Time

[b]Conclusion[/b]
This game is what every shooter should aspire to be. A game that gets better, and better, and better. A game that will suck you into its finely crafted world for a long time and game whose gameplay's utterly unrivaled. I cannot praise this game enough.

20487917.review:
Truly majestic FPS whose epic single player campaign remain in many ways unique to this day.

Unreal is a fantastic, atmospheric journey through beautifully realised alien world, one filled with a sense of mystery and wonder.  It is also a genuine visual and aural feast, and a game that presents level and specific sort of challenge that simply isn't seen anymore.

As is fitting for game's adventurous feel, its levels tend to be huge and exploration-heavy, and often require reading of various clues and careful scrutiny of one's environment in order to proceed. They are always expertly crafted and pleasing to the eye, be they ancient temples and moody ruins with their exquisite architecture, dark spaceship interiors or, especially, Na Pali's unforgettable outdoor locales. Many of Unreal's environments look genuinely beautiful to this day, which is no small feat.

Another expertly crafted element is the soundtrack, which simply cannot be praised enough. Whether the tracks are subtle and evocative, perfectly fitting for game's slower and exploratory sections, or fast and pumping ones that enhance many of game's intense gunfights, they are always excellent and memorable.

Now, game's gunfight are perhaps its most unusual part, one that will make it or break it for most players. Unreal opted for something quite different from the norm: while it has its share of simpler enemies that are focused on simply attacking the player while moving in his general direction (say, some of Na Pali's native fauna), major part of the game is exact opposite from mowing thru hordes of uninteligent meat. Unreal's most dangerous enemies are sparsely placed through its spacious maps, they are agile, hard hitting, constantly in motion and surprisingly intelligent (they will dodge your projectiles, run to cover, fake death etc). Surviving your encounters with these bastards requires fast reflexes, awareness of your immediate surroundings and understanding the nuances of game's varied and creative (and highly satisfying, if one allows it to be) weapon arsenal.

This is a must play, and for a particular kind of player that can fully appreciate it, Unreal remains truly one of a kind game: one that was unique back in the day, and one that is even more special today.

Just like online MonsterHunt in UT99, except it's singleplayer. It's pretty well done for what it is. The levels are actually suprisingly well done. The Nali water-god temple in particular has lots of secrets and is very reminiscent of Doom style level design. The Skaarj are my absolute favorite, fearsome monsters ever created. However most of the other monsters don't really give you a challenge. There's not even a lot of them, they are just a bit tanky. Skaaraj though, if you are up aginst 2-3 of them, you are in trouble. Especially if they are troopers armed with some of the stronger guns.

[b]PLEASE NOTE:[/b] There is no DirectInput for the mouse in the game, it's just a broken checkbox, so chances are you will play this with mouse lag. However, you CAN import the files from Unreal Gold into UT99 (just copy over into the UT folder, DO NOT OVERWIRITE) and play it with proper mouse controls and UT weapons :)

20219149.review:
Doom、Quakeの流れを汲んだ、後の「スポーツ系ＦＰＳ」というジャンルを築き上げた偉大なＦＰＳシリーズの１作目。1998年発売なのにグラフィックは非常によく、操作感覚も最近のＦＰＳに慣れた人でも非常に扱いやすい。敵のＡＩも多彩で、特に本作を代表する敵キャラであるSkaaj(スカージ)の動きは必見。まあその動きのせいで厄介な敵になっているのだが。さらにキャンペーンの平均クリア時間が２０時間、追加エピソードのReturn to Na Paliも７～８時間という、現在のＦＰＳから見ても破格のボリュームの多さも特徴的だ。まあそれには複雑で広大なマップと、所々の謎解き要素によるところが大きいが。

しかもトゥームレイダー然り、昔の３Ｄアクションゲームにはよくあることだが、謎解きに関するヒントが全くと言っていいほどないので、攻略サイトは必須だ。それでも、広大なマップの謎を苦労して解き、強力な敵を多様な武器で倒しながら進めたときの達成感はひとしおだ。

さらに、１作目からすでにデスマッチとＴＤＭ限定ではあるがＢｏｔ戦と対人戦要素がある。Ｂｏｔ戦は後のアンリアルトーナメントよりも難易度が高めで、ＵＴでもおなじみのDeck16などのマップがすでに収録されているため、ファンにもおすすめだ。

Steamでは安く購入できる他、現在のＰＣならほとんどの環境で快適に動作するため、アンリアルシリーズのファンのみならずＦＰＳプレイヤー全体に勧めたい一作だ。

19090480.review:
[b]Прекрасная и очень тяжелая игра детства[/b]
Первое что нужно понять : Сравнивать Unreal с современными шутерами категорически нельзя!!!(Но я всё равно буду это делать, хехехехехех)

-Начнём с того что она очень длинная. В игре 38 уровней! Игрок за это время посетит, аж три космических коробля, побывает в джунглях На-Поли, в храмах, замках, святилищах, под землёй, над землёй. Потом, некоторые уровни этой игры ОЧЕНЬ запутаны и под "очень", я подразумеваю, что настолько запутаны, что ситауция, когда вы бегаете туда-сюда в течении полутора часов, вполне нормальная.(Совсем уже разжирел от рельсовых шутеров, мм?) . Сами уровни сделаны очень красивыми, я уверен что тогда такой графен, был таким же требовательным как и Arkham Knight в наше время.  

-Также, стоит отметить, что в этой игре ужасно хитрожопые враги! Скаржди постоянно уворачиваются от ваших выстрелов, а некоторые рядовые мобы просто могут включить бессмертие!!! Или щит, или могут летать. Вообщем, враги здесь умнее чем во всех Call of Duty вместе взятых.

-Музыка в игре просто шикардос, я конечно могу ошибаться, но помоему на каждый из уровней записана своя музыкальная дорожка. И каждая из дорожек разделена на фазы, такие как Фон, Напряжение, Бой.

Подводя итог, хочется сказать что для своего времени игра была очень хороша, но сейчас поиграть в неё или даже пройти полностью, смогут только лишь олдовые бородатые игроки или такие игроки, у которых PC не тянет современные игры. как у меня. Но даже если вы дитя MLG , вам всё же стоит ознакомиться с данным продуктом, хотя бы чтобы понять как делали игры раньше  и что случилось с ними сейчас. Да и просто из любопытсва, мол смотри во что твой папка рубал в своё время.

Моя оценка крепкие 8,0 из 10 -за Unreal, и 7,0 за DLC. Ниже не позволяет поставить совесть, а выше здравый смысл.

Zahrát si kultovní Unreal po 10 letech a opět na Unreal obtížnost mi vrátilo spousty skvělých zpomínek na tuto výbornou hru. Na svou dobu hra nabízí opravdu unikátní herní zážitek, jak graficky tak hlavně hratelností. Nepřátelé nejsou žádní zalenáči a velmi bravurně uhýbají vašim střelám a sami máte občas problém jim uhýbat. Příběh a mapy jsou zpacované k dokonalosti, hudební doprovod je velmi schopný. Pokud by se mě někdo zeptal, která hra mě během mého života nejvíce oslovila, bez váhání bych odpověděl Unreal. Tuto hru můžu bez sebemenšího váhání doporučit.

Edice Unreal Gold obsahuje i výborný datadisk Unreal Return to Na Pali, který je na poměry datadisku vcelku dlouhý. Navíc obsahuje nové zbraně a nové nepřátele. Datadisk je pokračováním singleplayeru Unreal, s chytlavým příběhem, kdy jste nuceni se opět vrátit na planetu Na Pali.

Hodnocení Unrealu: 10/10
Hodnocení Unreal Return to Na Pali: 9/10
