-: smiešne hodnotenie po každej úrovni, finálový boss, koniec, hracia doba, málo nového, atmosféra, bugy

+: nové prostredia a zbrane, hudba, animácie, nepriatelia, dizajn, soundtrack, príbeh

Verdikt: Návrat do Na Pali je trochu sklamaním. Atmosféru narúša trápne hodnotenie na konci každej úrovni ako pätnásťročná baba s denníkom. Finálny boss je podivný a jednoducho mohol byť lepší ako aj celkový koniec hry. S hracou dobou to tiež nie je najlepšie. Naopak oproti pôvodnému Unreal-u si polepšila UI nepriateľov. Hoci to stále nieje ono, ale je tam pokrok. Návrat do Na Pali sa celkovo nevydaril podľa predstáv a očakávaní fanúšikov. Toto rozšírenie pôvodnej hry nenadväzuje na jej kvality.

61%

Переиздание легендарной игры Unreal, в которое также включено популярное дополнение Return to Na Pali и мультиплеер.
Сама игра интересная и затягивающая. В ней прекрасная музыка от Александра Брендона и Михиля ван ден Боса и офигенное оформление. В ней есть челленж, в ней есть крутые пушки. В ней есть офигенный сюжет, в ней есть офигенный движок (который даже сейчас позволяет играть в игру на большом экране и не блевать кровью). Над игрой работал сам Клифф Блезински.
Главный минус — огромные локации, на которых очень легко заблудиться и очень сложно найти то место, куда вообще нужно идти.
Мультиплеер прекрасен, однако сейчас малой популярностью пользуется. Впрочем, всегда можно наткнуться на рабочие DM, CTF и Co-op сервера. Да, тут есть кооперативный режим. В нём весело. Кстати, да, обязательно нужно поставить последний Community-patch для игры по сети, так как почти все сервера на нём работают.
Ради мультиплеера лучше купить Unreal Tournament, поставить на него последний патч и сверху накатить мод oldschool'd, который добавляет возможность прохождения оригинального Unreal и всех его продолжений/дополнений на движке Unreal Tournament, а также добавляет кооперативное прохождение.

1092943.review:
Unreal was a massive technical achievement for it's time. While not the first game to implement skyboxes, it was one of the first to show what one could do with them. 

The game takes place in the alien landscape of Na Pali. You explore this rough foreign location while dealing with the locals that get in your way. Unreal's engine was very innovative for the time. It tried to do a lot of things to stand out compared to it's main competition: Quake 2. 

While Quake 2 was a corridor shooter taking place in futuristic bunkers and facilities. Unreal took place in jungles, and temples worshipping long dead gods. You find a universal translator early on in the game and the raw detail that goes into the backstory of Na Pali is extraordinary. You can see this legacy continued in later games such as Morrowind and Halo.

The Gold Pack comes with the core game, plus it's expansion pack. All updated to UT1's engine, so you know mostly what to expect if you've played that game.

1762272.review:
Not only one of my all-time favorite games now, but I'll even say one of the greatest, most impressive games ever FUCKING made. The original Unreal is a masterpiece in every sense of the word. Lots of awesome original weapons, all with alternate fires, all super fun, and with such meaty sound design. And you gotta love those super deep-voiced grunts when you jump. Lots of fascinating enemies and NPC interactions. Really great lore and worldbuilding from the text logs you can observe, and a real sense of scale and gravitas with the story despite the complete lack of dialogue. No cutscenes, all real-time and ambient, but with sick-ass music. Brilliant, brilliant, brilliant map design, with breathtakingly expansive levels to explore. 

Aesthetically, everything in the game is just beautiful, even today. Such colorful and lush sci fi landscapes and architecture, and not just the usual everything-is-metal-and-high-tech stuff you often think of when thinking of sci fi settings. It's truly an alien world... And the enemy AI is actually challenging and crazy smart, which is just astounding considering this is a game from 1998 and how lame AI often still is today. The game is really challenging in general, and it is very long.

When I think of a true JOURNEY of a game, I think of this very Unreal right here. No fucking Tournament, just plain-ass original Unreal 1 right the fuck here. It is positively... UNREAL, the places you'll go in this game. The very definition of an adventure. People always going on about how great Half-life is, but I honestly feel this game might be a notch or two more amazing than Half-life, for the same sorts of reasons Half-life 1 was/is awesome. And I do fucking LOVE Half-life. This game... This game gave me feelings, guys. Real fucking feelings. I was truly in awe. This game should be recognized more, and it has my 100% recommendation, especially considering the price.


The expansion, Return to Na Pali gives a bunch more levels for even more Unreal goodness and continues the story directly where Unreal 1 left off, but the player character is suddenly given a voice, and I think that goes against what the original Unreal was about. He'll (you'll) talk in between levels in some dumb kinda unncessary monologue about what just happened and what's going to happen next. So Return to Na Pali is the same fun as Unreal 1, but with some mediocre new narrative style. So even including Return to Na Pali and Unreal 2 (which goes even further into the voiced characters, try-hard hamfisted story bullshit territory, and is really quite a different kind of game altogether), there truly hasn't been another game quite like Unreal since Unreal came out all these years ago, and while the Unreal Tournament games aren't bad, I think it's a damn shame Epic (Mega)Games never made another game as incredible in the way Unreal was. Here's hoping for a really good current-gen remake of some sort; this singleplayer Unreal truly deserves another chance in the spotlight. Or perhaps a whole new Unreal game altogether, if they can nail it like this one did, and take away from the stains of Return to Na Pali and Unreal 2. It is one of the most amazing experiences I've ever played, and I wish more people could understand what I'm talking about by playing the game for themselves. So go do that, reader! It's totally worth it, trust me on this one. That so few people talk about this game just astounds me. And there's also multiplayer, yes.

Definitely recommended for anyone seeking to plot the history and evolution of the FPS genre.

Unreal est un grand FPS de la fin des années 90 qui m'a beaucoup marqué à l'époque. Les graphismes révolutionnaient les jeux de l'époque.
Après y avoir rejoué récemment des choses m'ont surpris :
-L'IA des ennemis est plutôt avancée par rapport à ce qui se fait aujourd'hui, ils évitent vos projectiles plutôt que de se laisser toucher bêtement, les combats sont souvent un challenge.
-Le Level Design est assez complexe, les maps paraîssent immenses.

Et cerise sur le gateau, la musique est exceptionnelle, ce fut le cas pour les autres jeux du développeur (je pense à Deus Ex notamment).

Puis la durée de vie est plutôt longue pour les fps d'aujourd'hui, j'ai fini le solo d'Unreal Gold en 20 heures à la difficulté la plus élevée, en essayant d'explorer un maximum et en m'intéressant aux éléments narratifs.

Bref c'est à recommander aux amateurs, ainsi qu'aux jeunes joueurs, qui sachent ce qu'étaient un FPS, au temps où ils étaient encore à leur apogée.

1305931.review:
Unreal Gold is the prefered title in the Unreal Series - and perhaps their masterpiece.

Boasting gorgeous visuals, a fantastic soundtrack, and lengthy, satisfying gameplay based on the reflex system really gives gamers a step up in quality from the generic shooters of today. Unreal Gold is an exceptionally well done title, with complex map and world design, encouraging the exploration of levels and scenery. There is a story told within the game - mostly in text logs and level pacing. It's old fashioned and true, requiring not countless hours of cinematics taking up the entire game. 

Unreal Gold suffers from one huge flaw, and that is the lack of an FPS cap. For older computers that was not a problem, but for todays more powerful rigs and technology, it is. The game essentially runs without a hitch, but to make it playable you will need to download community patches to address the issue of having unlimited FPS. 

Unreal Gold is an excellent title and despite the years gone by it still stands fast in terms of quality and entertainment to be derived from it. I highly recommend this fantastic product!

Unreal has quite simply got to be one of my favourite games of all time, they simply don't make games like they used to!

Back in 1998 Unreal had very impressive graphics and had far better gameplay than the likes of its rivals. The basic plot is that you, Prisoner 849, are aboard the the prision ship Vortex Rikers when it crashes on the planet Na Pali. From there on out you have to fight to survive as you trek across the planet looking for a way off. 

Also included in this pack is the expansion "Return to Na Pali", which adds addtional content and game-play.

Unreal has recieved several updates from the community so the game can not only be played, but run at a decent level of graphical quality. Some of the models are a bit '1998' looking still, but even that is being worked on. There is of course many mods, maps, skins and all the usual community content out there to exend the game in ways you see fit.

This remains my favorite game. It has everything I love:

3731069.review:
When I first played Unreal I was just a stupid kid. I hated this game as a kid. I couldnt' get used to the movement, the enemy AI and guns at the time. But I recently bought Unreal and Unreal Tournament 99 and 2004 on GOG. So I thought I should do a review that gives the game justice. 

Unreal basically is a game where you are a prisoner that crash lands on a planet. Your goal is to get out alive. You go from alien ship to building killing loads of enemies while solving puzzles with fast precise movement and strafing. Not plot heavy, but hey, it's a old school FPS it doesn't need to.

Now that I'm 20, I love this game to death. I play the DRM free version of it actually. The main reason I love this game is because it's old school. I love the old school genre of FPS Games like Serious Sam, Doom, Blood 2, Painkiller, and recently DUSK. 

The movement is so amazing. It feels like you are actually experiencing an earthquake at one point and that is just an achievement in it's own right. The movement is one of the best things about the game. I love it.

The enemy AI is some of the best I have ever encountered in a video game, they are difficult to kill, but yet they seem fair to the challenge of the entire game. When you kill a boss, it feels like you are strong and have accomplished something.

The graphics are amazing too (Well, in 1998) As with Half Life's Gold Source Engine, Unreal uses it's Unreal Engine 1, making it revolutionary for the time being. Many other engines followed in the coming years leading to Unreal Tournament 4 (Or UT 2017) which has continued the arena based shooter franchise.

Overall, the game is fantastic is still holds up with the original Unreal Tournament.

But before I end my review, I want you people to stay away from the Sequel Unreal 2 The Awakening. It ruined any chance of a Unreal 3 due to it's clunky shooting and slow movement controls and bascially having nothing to do with the original Unreal. It was obviously made for consoles as it was released on Xbox. But Unreal Championship was like a launch title and that was better than Unreal 2! 

Whatever. I'll just stop my blabbering here. BUY THE GAME! :D

836102.review: A beautiful classic, released back in the days of the 486 when only nerds living in their mom's basement could put together enough components to run a game like this with a graphics accelerator. A classic story that really showcases early first person shooter designs, and reflects some of the beginning influences for many of the game elements that are so commonly used today. Many of those methods and techniques were tried first, in games like these. Some made it, while others were trashed and never used again, even though some people did like them. Buy this game for a classic experience with the first Unreal engine, and the classic gameplay and storyline from back in the day. It's a real retro blast from the past, and a great way to wax nostalgic, or get a cheap simple game for wiling the time away on a common household PC that isn't a gaming monster.
